definitions: Moving slowly, especially as carried by a current of air or water.
Being carried along by a current of air or water.
Moving aimlessly from place to place.
Gradually changing from one state or activity to another.
Accumulating in drifts, especially of snow or sand.
examples: The boat was drifting out to sea.
He spent years drifting from job to job.
Snow was drifting against the fence.
She felt herself drifting off to sleep.
The conversation was drifting towards politics.
